reviews.review_msg: I have taken a couple of accounting classes with her. She provides a lot of resources that requires tons of reading and prep but she is very caring and helpful both inside and outside the classroom. Getting a good grade is definitely possible if you spend the time and effort she expects.
She has really long slides with excel screenshot of examples. The lectures are not really helpful, you will need a lot of self study. Fair exams but pretty long.

She's very nice but her exams were somewhat difficult and in class just reads off slides (which are nothing like the exams). There's a huge group project and another one as well but its related to sustainability and balanced scorecard concepts when really, I'd prefer to just do accounting practice! I felt like I only learned fluff in this class.

FYI think she read the reviews and made changes to her exams. Midterm was okay, but final exam was hilariously difficult. The questions she provides has nothing to do with the exams lol. 

Term paper and presentation had high averages and weren't too troublesome though. 

She replies to emails pretty quick so there's that.

Pray for the curve boys

Terrible instructor that has no teaching skills. This is a self taught course and it is pointless to show up to lecture. You gain no benefit from attending lecture. Her lectures actually make you even more confused.
Fereshteh is a great prof. She is very caring, approachable, and easy to talk to.

Fereshteh is really nice but can be disorganized at times. Exams have really high averages, around 80-85% and the term paper and presentation averages were even higher, around 90%. You literally have to get perfect scores on everything for an A. Although she's approachable, when I asked her questions at office hours, I left even more confused lol

I had Bus 320 and 322 with her. I like her as a person but as a prof i think she still has areas to work on. Her finals averages are SUPER high, like 80-84, with basically you have to do well to get just an average. The term paper for both classes had super high averages too.
One of the nicest accounting profs. I took BUS 320 and BUS 322 with her. She provides a lot of notes and her powerpoints are very helpful and clear. She is always available for help if you need it.

Nice person, but very unorganized. We had a presentation worth 35% and all we had to go off was previous years examples, no rubric. Further instructions were added 24 hours before presenting. He was also on his phone during every presentation and told us that in previous years the highest mark went to the nicest looking PowerPoint and not content.

Literally better off not going to lecture. He constantly goes off on rants that are vaguely related to the course and doesn't teach you anything that is going to be on the tests. He gives practice exams at least.

Ray is a good prof. He focuses on teaching the core concepts of the course instead of giving long lectures on theory. Provides with homework and practice questions which are similar to exam questions. Textbook not required. Overall a solid choice.

I took BUS 322 in Fall and found Ray is a fair professor. He does not walk you through step-by-step for practice questions cause you can learn ALL calculations in his TA's notes which is given. Be careful, he drops hints in lecture which essay questions will be on exams. Final is harder than midterm. Group is self-construced, wisely choose members.

DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS. WORST PROF I'VE EVER SEEN. Unorganized at all. You dont need him to learn the course, and you pay the tuition for self-studying. No one else would be worse than him. If you see his name when enrolling coursestake the course next time, please. I dont comment on his grading, but he is definitely a bad lecturer.

Easily the most unorganized professor I have had in my time at SFU. His lectures are also all qualitative and then the exams are completely quantitative so you have to study on your own a lot. However, the exams are easy if you read the textbook and do the homework questions. During presentations, he was either on his phone or about to fall asleep.
Terrible. Does not know what he is talking about. No interest in the subject. Uses handphone all the time
He's a very nice professor, who provides detailed descriptions of knowledge and practical feedback.
Ray is a nice guy. He is glad to help students. Although he is relatively new in Beedie for teaching, accounting seems to be his profession.

This professor had no idea what he was talking about and was incredibly disorganized. Incorrect solutions were posted for homework questions and he did not write his own exams. Marking was very unfair; part marks were not given for any questions. The professor was on his phone during our presentations and refused to answer questions during exams.

Safia is a super nice prof! The content is not super difficult compared to the other 300-level acc courses. The midterm is quite easy, but final was a bit more difficult. Make sure to do the questions and practice exams she provides and you will be set! Find a good group for the presentation, and ask clarifying questions. Curve is relatively high.
Good Professor.
funny and gives good examples that back up the material. is giving us a pizza party on the last day. shoutout ray zhang

A bit disorganized, but he is very effective at synthesizing the textbook information and providing lots of relevant examples during lectures. if you take him, go to class! he's a pretty chill dude too.

Ray is a nice person, but his class is very unorganized. There is a presentation worth quite a significant chunk of your grade, yet no criteria or rubric was provided for it. The guidelines (e.g., how long it should be) for the presentation were sent out with less than 24 hours' notice before the presentation date.

She is awful and should not be teaching at a Post secondary level
She is difficult to understand due to her strong accent. When asked a question, she never knows the answers.
Avoid her if possible. You are better off reading your text book that attending her classes as she just reads her slides that gets forn the text book.  You will be on your own

the worst prof  i have ever had in sfu. she reads the slides, without adding any extra explanation. regret for the whole semester because i need to study all the materials by myself. and she is never available in her office hour.
She read slides, nothing else. Her accent is really heavy, and she could not answer questions properly because her English is terrible.
